result.execSummary:
The defendant Deangelo E Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Return of Judgment/Notice of Entry of Judgment and of Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitres and Other Financial Obligations to defendant.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Discharge - Regular
3rd party letter

Defendant Deangelo E Harris in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.

Court orders the following:
- 9 months Huber with standard release conditions CONSECUTIVE to any current sentence. STAYED
- 1 year 6 months Probation CONCURRENT with any current Probation
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Restitution of $500.00 (solely liable) to be paid as a Condition of Probation to Walmart
- Conditions of Probation:  Follow through with all appointments with Agent and for counseling.  Maintain part-time employment.  Continue to pursue education.
Sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
